concept: Newton's first law of motion: An object at rest remains at rest, or if in motion, remains in motion at a constant velocity unless acted on by a net external force.
Types of Energy: Kinetic, Potential, Mechanical, Heat, Light, Sound.
Simple Machines: Lever, Pulley, Wheel and Axle, Inclined Plane, Wedge, Screw.
Types of Forces: Gravity, Friction, Magnetic, Electrical.
Measurement and Units: Length, Mass, Time, Volume, Density, Speed.
Force = Mass × Acceleration (F = ma)
Work = Force × Distance (W = Fd)
Kinetic Energy = 0.5 × Mass × Velocity^2 (KE = 0.5mv^2)
Gravitational Potential Energy = Mass × Gravity × Height (PE = mgh)
Density = Mass / Volume (ρ = m/V)
Light: Reflection, Refraction, Dispersion.
Newton's second law states that the acceleration of an object is directly related to the net force and inversely related to its mass.
Electricity: Circuits, Conductors, Insulators, Ohm's Law.
Magnetism: Magnetic Fields, Magnetic Force, Electromagnetism.
Heat Transfer: Conduction, Convection, Radiation.
Speed = Distance / Time (v = d/t)
Acceleration = Change in Velocity / Time (a = Δv/t)
Force = Spring Constant × Displacement (F = kx)
Ohm's Law: Voltage = Current × Resistance (V = IR)
Momentum: Momentum = mass x velocity (p = mv)
Waves: Types, Properties, Wave Behavior.
Optics: Lenses, Mirrors, Snell's Law.
Electricity and Magnetism: Electromagnetic Induction, Faraday's Law. Whenever a conductor is placed in a varying magnetic field, an electromotive force is induced.
Energy: Conservation of Energy, Energy Transformation.
Fluid Dynamics: Pressure, Buoyancy, Bernoulli's Principle. The pressure in a fluid decreases as the fluid's velocity increases.
Wave Speed = Frequency × Wavelength (v = fλ)
Index of Refraction = Speed of Light in Vacuum / Speed of Light in Material (n = c/v)
Faraday's Law of Electromagnetic Induction: EMF = -N ΔΦ/Δt
Conservation of Energy: Total Energy = Kinetic Energy + Potential Energy (E = KE + PE)
Pressure = Force / Area (P = F/A)
Gravity: Gravitational Force, Orbits, Kepler's Laws.
Atomic Structure: Subatomic Particles, Electron Configuration.
Thermodynamics: Laws, Heat Engines, Entropy. Describe how the energy in a system changes and whether the system can perform useful work on its surroundings.
Electric Circuits: Kirchhoff's Laws, Series and Parallel Circuits.
Wave Behaviour: Interference, Diffraction, Polarisation.
Gravitational Force = G × (m1 × m2) / r^2
Bohr's Model: Energy Levels = -13.6eV / n^2
First Law of Thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W
Heat of Fusion: q = m * ΔHF
Latent Heat: L = Q / M
Electromagnetism: Maxwell's Equations, Electromagnetic Waves. c = 1√μ0ϵ0.
Quantum Mechanics: Wave-Particle Duality, Heisenberg Uncertainty Principle.
Special Relativity: Time Dilation, Length Contraction, Mass-Energy Equivalence.
Nuclear Physics: Nuclear Decay, Radioactive Half-Life, Nuclear Reactions.
Astrophysics: Stellar Evolution, Cosmology, Black Holes. Stellar-mass black holes likely originated as mismatched stars where the more massive one evolved rapidly into a black hole.
Maxwell's Equations: ∇⋅E = ρ/ε0, ∇⋅B = 0, ∇×E = -∂B/∂t, ∇×B = μ0J + μ0ε0 ∂E/∂t
de Broglie Wavelength: λ = h / p
Time Dilation: Δt' = Δt / √(1 - v^2/c^2)
Half-Life: t1/2 = (ln 2) / λ
Schwarzschild Radius: Rs = 2GM / c^2
Particle Physics: Standard Model, Fundamental Forces.
String Theory: Extra Dimensions, Vibrating Strings.
Cosmology: Big Bang Theory, Dark Matter, Dark Energy. Dark matter governs the cosmos, forming galaxies and galaxy clusters; dark energy control the future, pushing galaxies farther apart
Quantum Field Theory: Field Particles, Quantum Fluctuations. Quantum fluctuation is the temporary random change in the amount of energy in a point in space,
General Relativity: Curved Spacetime, Gravitational Waves.
Standard Model: Describes Electromagnetic, Weak, and Strong Nuclear Interactions.
String Tension: T = (F/A) × L
Critical Density: ρc = 3H^2 / 8πG
Vacuum Energy: E = ħ × ω / 2
Einstein Field Equations: Gμν = 8πGTμν
Black Hole Thermodynamics: Hawking Radiation, Entropy of Black Holes.
Grand Unified Theory (GUT): Unification of Fundamental Forces.
Multiverse Theory: Parallel Universes, Cosmic Inflation.
Quantum Gravity: Unified Theory of Gravity and Quantum Mechanics.
Extra Dimensions: Kaluza-Klein Theory, String Theory.
Hawking Radiation: L = (ħc^3) / (16πGM^2)
GUT Energy Scale: ΛGUT ≈ 10^16 GeV
Multiverse Probability: P = ∫ |Ψ|^2 dV
Quantum Gravity Energy: E = ħc^5 / (32πGħ)
Kaluza-Klein Compactification: R = r0 + α' ln(M^2 r0)
